model

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Model

  • public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines the component that manages the in-memory storage of GitHub issues, as well as synchronizing data with GitHub. There is only 1 instance of Model for the entire session.
    Author:
    ZiXian92

      • getInstance

        public static Model getInstance()
        Gets the only instance of Model.
        Returns:
        The only instance of this class.

      • addObserver

        public void addObserver(Observer observer)
        Adds the given observer to the list of observers.
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer object to be added. Cannot be null.

      • loginUser

        public boolean loginUser(java.lang.String username,
                         java.lang.String password)
                  throws RequestException
        Authenticates the user with the given username with GitHub API.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user to log in.
        password - The password for the givne username.
        Returns:
        true if authentication is successful and false otherwise.
        Throws:
        RequestException - If an error occurs while connecting to GitHub API.

      • initialise

        public void initialise()
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       RequestException,
                       FailedRequestException,
                       MissingMessageException,
                       org.json.JSONException
        Loads the repositories and issues from GitHub. Clears all current data in the process.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during the request.
        RequestException - If an error occurs when sending the request.
        FailedRequestException - If the request fails.
        MissingMessageException - If the message is missing from the response.
        org.json.JSONException - If an error occurs when parsing the list of repositories.

      • listRepositories

        public java.lang.String[] listRepositories()
        Gets the list of repositories that the current user is involved in.
        Returns:
        The list of names of repositories that the current user is involved in or null if the list is empty.

      • updateRepo

        public void updateRepo(Repository repo)
                throws FailedRequestException,
                       MissingMessageException,
                       org.json.JSONException,
                       RequestException
        Fetches issues under the specified repository and stores them in a Repository instance.
        Parameters:
        repo - The repository to update from GitHub.
        Throws:
        FailedRequestException - If the request fails.
        MissingMessageException - If the message is missing in the response.
        org.json.JSONException - If an error occurs when parsing the response object.
        RequestException - If an error occurs when sending the request.

      • updateIssue

        public void updateIssue(Issue issue)
                 throws FailedRequestException,
                        RequestException,
                        MissingMessageException,
                        org.json.JSONException
        Completes the update of the given issue.
        Parameters:
        issue - The issue to fetch comments for.
        Throws:
        FailedRequestException - If the request fails.
        RequestException - If an error occurred when sending the request.
        MissingMessageException - If the JSON contents are missing from the response.
        org.json.JSONException - If an error occurred when parsing the response JSON object.

      • getRepository

        public Repository getRepository(int index)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Gets the repository based on its index in the list. Updates with information from GitHub on first access.
        Parameters:
        index - An integer between 1 and the number of repositories in the list.
        Returns:
        The index-th Repository instance in the list or null if index is invalid.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error occurred while updating the repository.

      • getRepository

        public Repository getRepository(java.lang.String repoName)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Gets the repository from the list given the repository name.
        Parameters:
        repoName - The full name of the repository to retrieve. Cannot be null or empty.
        Returns:
        The Repository with the given name or null if the given repository cannot be found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs while updating the repository.

      • getIssue

        public Issue getIssue(java.lang.String issueName,
                      java.lang.String repoName)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Gets the specified issue from the given repository.
        Parameters:
        issueName - The name of the issue to be selected or the index of the issue in the repository, starting from 1.
        repoName - The full name of the repository that contains the issue to be selected. Cannot be null or empty.
        Returns:
        The issue with the given issue name from the given repository or null if the repository and/or issue cannot be found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs while updating the issue.

      • addRepository

        public void addRepository(Repository repo)
        Adds the given repository locally only if there is no repository with the same full name.
        Parameters:
        repo - The repository to be added.

      • addIssue

        public Issue addIssue(org.json.JSONObject jsonIssue,
                      java.lang.String repoName)
               throws org.json.JSONException,
                      FailedRequestException,
                      MissingMessageException,
                      RequestException
        Adds the given issue(in JSON string format) to the given repository.
        Parameters:
        jsonIssue - The JSON representation of the issue to be added. Cannot be null or empty.
        repoName - The name of the repository to add the issue to.
        Returns:
        The created issue. Returns null if the repository is not found or cannot be updated.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - If an error occurs when parsing the JSON representation of the new issue.
        FailedRequestException - If the request fails.
        MissingMessageException - If the message is missing from the response.
        RequestException - If an error occurred while sending the request.

      • editIssue

        public Issue editIssue(org.json.JSONObject changes,
                       java.lang.String issueName,
                       java.lang.String repoName)
                throws org.json.JSONException,
                       RequestException,
                       FailedRequestException,
                       MissingMessageException
        Edits the given issue with the given changes.
        Parameters:
        changes - The JSON object representing the changes to be made.
        repoName - The name of the repository containing the issue to be edited.
        issueName - The name of the issue to be edited.
        Returns:
        The edited issue. Returns the original issue if the request fails or the response message does not exist. Returns null if the given issue and/or repository cannot be found.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - If an error occurs while parsing the JSON object in the response.
        RequestException - If an error occurs while sending the request.
        FailedRequestException - If the request fails
        MissingMessageException - If the message containing the edited issue is missing from the response.

      • addComment

        public Issue addComment(org.json.JSONObject comment,
                        java.lang.String issueName,
                        java.lang.String repoName)
                 throws FailedRequestException,
                        MissingMessageException,
                        RequestException,
                        org.json.JSONException
        Adds the given comment to the given issue.
        Parameters:
        comment - The JSON representation of comment to add.
        issueName - The name of the issue to add comment to.
        repoName - The name of the repository holding the issue to be commented on.
        Returns:
        The edited issue with the added comment.
        Throws:
        FailedRequestException - If the request was unsuccessful.
        MissingMessageException - If the response does not have any message.
        RequestException - If an error occurred while executing the request.
        org.json.JSONException - If an error occurs while parsing the newly created comment.
